turns.speaker: WENDELL
turns.text: ...I believe they've done lit a shuck.

turns.speaker: WENDELL
turns.text: You think this boy Moss has got any notion of the sorts of sons of bitches that are huntin' him?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: I don't know. He ought to...

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Well, Wendell, with all due respect, that don't make a whole lot of sense.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: You said entrance wound in the forehead, no exit wound.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Are you telling me he shot this boy in the head and then went fishin' around in there with a pocket knife?

turns.speaker: WENDELL
turns.text: Sir, I don't want to picture that.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Yes Noreen you better had. Thank you.

turns.speaker: WENDELL
turns.text: The Rangers and DEA are heading out to the desert this morning. You gonna join 'em?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: I don't know. Any new bodies accumulated out there?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Well then I guess I can skip it. Heavens to Betsy, Wendell, you already put me off my breakfast.

turns.speaker: WENDELL
turns.text: Yessir. None of the three had ID on 'em but they're tellin' me all three is Mexicans. Was Mexicans.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: There's a question. Whether they stopped bein'. And when.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Now, Wendell, did you inquire about the cylinder lock?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: No, that's the only thing I would've looked for. And it sounds like these boys died of natural causes.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Natural to the line of work they was in.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: My lord, Wendell, it's just all-out war. I  don't know any other word for it. Who are these folks? I don't know...

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: That DEA agent called again. You don't want to talk to him?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: I'm goin' to try and keep from it as much as I can.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: He's goin' back out there and he wanted to know if you wanted to go with him.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: ...Could I get you to call Loretta and tell her I've gone to Odessa? goin' to visit with Carla Jean Moss.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: I'll call Loretta when I get there. I'd call now but she'll want me to come home and I just might.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You want me to wait til you've quit the building?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Yes I do. You don't want to lie without what it's absolutely necessary.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: ...What is it that Torbert says? About truth and justice?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: We dedicate ourselves daily anew. Something like that.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: I think I'm goin' to commence dedicatin' myself twice daily. It may come to three times before it's over...

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I thought it was a car afire.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: It is a car afire. But Wendell said there was something back country too.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: When is the county gonna start payin' a rental on my horse.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: ...I love you more'n more, ever day.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: I mean, would you care to join me.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Well you got time for 'em now. Anything interesting?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Well they always is to the party concerned.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Okay. Two of 'em. Both had my father. It's peculiar. I'm older now'n he ever was by twenty years. So in a sense he's the younger man. Anyway, first one I don't remember so well but it was about meetin' him in town somewheres and he give me some money and I think I lost it. The second one, it was like we was both back in older times and I was on horseback goin' through the mountains of a night.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: It ain't even three years we been married.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Three years ago I said them very words. No and Good.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: Well I put it in. That one. You just set there. I'll get tickets and a cart for the bags.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: What little I had is long gone and they's bill aplenty to pay yet. I buried my mother today. I ain't paid for that neither.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: ...You got no cause to hurt me.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: No. But I gave my word.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: That don't make sense. You gave your word to my husband to kill me?

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: Your husband had the opportunity to remove you from harm's way. Instead, he used you to try to save himself.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: Not like that. Not like you say.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: I don't say anything. Except it was foreseen.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: I knowed you was crazy when I saw you settin' there. I knowed exactly what was in store for me.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: What'd you give for that thing?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: You don't need to know everthing, Carla Jean.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: You keep running that mouth I'm gonna take you in the back and screw you.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: Fine. I don't wanna know. I don't even wanna know where you been all day.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Somethin' I forgot to do. I'll be back.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: ...If I don't come back tell Mother I love her.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Well then I'll tell her myself.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: Why would we go to Odessa?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Not we, you. Stay with your mother.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: So... for how long do we have to...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Baby, at what point would you quit botherin' to look for your two million dollars?

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: What'm I supposed to tell Mama?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Try standin' in the door and hollerin: Mama I'm home.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: C'mon, pack your things. Anything you leave you ain't gonna see again.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: Well thanks for fallin' all over and apologizing.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Things happened. I can't take 'em back.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: Why all the way to Del Rio?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I'm gonna borrow a car. From Eldon.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Don't wanna register it. I'll call you in a couple days.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: I got a bad feelin', Llewelyn.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Well I got  a good one. So they ought to even out. Quit worrying about everthing.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: She is just gonna cuss you up'n down.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: You should be used to that.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: I'm used to lots of things, I work at Wal-Mart.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Not any more, Carla Jean. You're retired.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: You are comin back, ain't ya?

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: I don't know, I had the sheriff here from Terrell County --

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: What did I know to tell him. You're hurt, ain't you?

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: I can hear it in your voice.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: Llewelyn, I ain't gonna leave you in the lurch.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: No. This works better. With you gone and I don't have the money, he can't touch me. But I can sure touch him. After I find him I'll come and join you.

turns.speaker: CARLA JEAN
turns.text: Find who? What am I supposed to do with Mother?

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: We don't have to do this. I'm a daytrader. I could just go home.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: Why would I let you do that?

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: I know where the money is.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: If you knew, you would have it with you.

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: I need dark. To get it. I know where it is.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: I know where it's going to be.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: It will be brought to me and placed at my feet.

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: You don't know to a certainty. Twenty minutes it could be here.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: I do know to a certainty. And you know what's going to happen now. You should admit your situation. There would be more dignity in it.

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: Do you have any idea how goddamn crazy you are?

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: You mean the nature of this conversation?

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: I mean the nature of you.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Did you go up to his trailer?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Well I'd say he's at work. Do you want to leave a message?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Sir I ain't at liberty to give out no information about our residents.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Did you not hear me? We can't give out no information.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: Step out of the car please, sir.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: I need you to step out of the car, sir.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: In the truck.  I'll get it.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Yeah, that'll suck some power. Over time.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Just lightin' out for the territories, huh. Brother, I been there... Well...

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I don't need to talk to you.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: I think that you do. Do you know where I'm going?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Why would I care where you're going.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: Do you know where I'm going?

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: You're in the hospital across the river. But that's not where I'm going. Do you know where I'm going?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Yeah. I know where you're going.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: You know she won't be there.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: It doesn't make any difference where she is.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: So what're you goin' up there for.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: You know how this is going to turn out, don't you?

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: Yes, I do. I think you do too. So this is what I'll offer. You bring me the money and I'll let her go. Otherwise she's accountable. The same as you. That's the best deal you're going to get. I won't tell you you can save yourself because you can't.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Yeah I'm goin' to bring you somethin' all right. I've decided to make you a special project of mine. You ain't goin' to have to look for me at all.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: He gave Acosta's people a receiver.

turns.speaker: MAN AT CHAIR
turns.text: He feels... he felt... the more people looking...

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: That's foolish. You pick the one right tool.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: ...For instance. I used birshot. So as not to blow the window.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: Y'all getting any rain up your way?

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: I seen you was from Dallas.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: What business is it of yours where I'm from, friendo?

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: I didn't mean nothin' by it.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: I was just passin' the time.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: I guess that passes for manners in your cracker view of things.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: Is that what you're asking me? Is there something wrong with anything?

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: Well... I need to see about closin'.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: Now is not a time. What time do you close.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: You don't know what you're talking about, do you?

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: I said you don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: ...What time do you go to bed.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: You're a bit deaf, aren't you? I said what time do you go to bed.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: ...I'd say around nine-thirty. Somewhere around nine-thirty.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: Why would you be comin' back? We'll be closed.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: Well... I need to close now --

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: You live in that house behind the store?

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: You've lived here all your life?

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: This was my wife's father's place. Originally.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: We lived in Temple Texas for many years. Raised a family there. In Temple. We come out here about four years ago.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: ...If that's the way you wanna put it.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: I don't have some way to put it. That's the way it is.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: ...What's the most you've ever lost on a coin toss?

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: The most. You ever lost. On a coin toss.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: I don't know. I couldn't say.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: Well -- we need to know what it is we're callin' for here.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: You need to call it. I can't call it for you. It wouldn't be fair. It wouldn't even be right.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: Yes you did. You been putting it up your whole life. You just didn't know it. You know what date is on this coin?

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: Nineteen fifty-eight. It's been traveling twenty-two years to get here. And now it's here. And it's either heads or tails, and you have to say. Call it.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: Look... I got to know what I stand to win.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: You stand to win everything. Call it.

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: Don't put it in your pocket. It's your lucky quarter.

turns.speaker: PROPRIETOR
turns.text: ...Where you want me to put it?

turns.speaker: CHIGURH
turns.text: Anywhere not in your pocket. Or it'll get mixed in with the others and become just a coin. Which it is.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Twelve gauge. You need shells? Moss looks the gun over.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Well you give me the model number of the tent I can order you the poles.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Never mind.  I want a tent.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: The kind with the most poles.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Well I guess that'd be our ten-foot backyard Per-Gola. You can stand up in it. Well, some people could stand up in it. Six foot clearance at the ridge. You might just could.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Let me have that one. Where's the nearest hardware store?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Yessir, be here til ten tomorrow morning.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: I'm waitin' to hear your description of that.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: There's somebody lookin' for me. Not police. Just call me if anyone else checks in tonight.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: You get a lot of people come in here with no clothes on?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Don't stop. Just ride me up past the rooms.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Just drive me around. I want to see if someone's here.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I don't want to get in some kind of a jackpot here, buddy.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Why don't I set you down here and we won't argue about it.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I want you to take me to another motel.

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: Yessir, that's correct. I know 'em when I see 'em.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: When did you last see him.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You seem pretty sure of the date. Did I ask you to sit?

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: No sir but you struck me as a man who wouldn't want to waste a chair. I remember dates. Names. Numbers. I saw him on November 28th.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: We got a loose cannon here. And we're out a bunch of money, and the other party is out his product.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: If your expenses run higher I hope you'll trust us for it.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: How well do you know Chigurh.

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: What do you want to know?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'd just like to know your opinion of him. In general. Just how dangerous is he?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: He killed three men in a motel in Del Rio yesterday. And two others at that colossal goatfuck out in the desert.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You seem pretty sure of yourself. You've led something of a charmed life haven't you Mr. Wells?

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: Can I get my parking ticket validated?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: ...You pick the option with the applicable rate.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I'm just one person. Don't matter the size of the bed.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: No, I want to keep my room, and get another one.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Uh-huh.You got a map of the rooms?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: You can have the one next to yours if you want. One twenty.  It ain't took.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I got beers in my room.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Oh. That's who you keep lookin' out the window for?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Yeah but no one ever sees that. I like a man that'll tell you he's married.

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: ...Don't worry. I'm not the man that's after you.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I know, I've seen him. Sort of.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: What is he supposed to be, the ultimate bad-ass?

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: I don't think that's how I would describe him.

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: I guess I'd say... that he doesn't have a sense of humor.  His name is Chigurh.

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: Chigurh. Anton Chigurh. You know how he found you?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I know how he found me.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: I know what it is. He won't find me again.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Any of it. If it can be welded I can weld it.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: So what does that make me? Your buddy?

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: Look. You need to give me the money. I've got no other reason to protect you.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Too late. I spent it -- about a million and a half on whores and whiskey and the rest of it I just sort of blew it in.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Why would he go to Odessa?

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Maybe he should be worried. About me.

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: He isn't. You're not cut out for this. You're just a guy that happened to find those vehicles.

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: ...You didn't take the product, did you?

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: The heroin. You don't have it.

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: ...I'm across the river. At the Hotel Eagle. Carson Wells.  Call me when you've had enough. I can even let you keep a little of the money.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: If I was cuttin' deals, why wouldn't I go deal with this guy Chigurh?

turns.speaker: WELLS
turns.text: No no. No. You don't understand. You can't make a deal with him. Even if you gave him the money he'd still kill you. He's a peculiar man. You could even say that he has principles. Principles that transcend money or drugs or anything like that. He's not like you. He's not even like me.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: He don't talk as much as you, I give him points for that.

turns.speaker: OFFICIAL
turns.text: Who do you think gets through this gate into the United States of America?

turns.speaker: OFFICIAL
turns.text: Some American citizens. Who do you think decides?

turns.speaker: OFFICIAL
turns.text: That is correct. And how do I decide?

turns.speaker: OFFICIAL
turns.text: I ask questions. If I get sensible answers then they get to go to America. If I don't get sensible answers they don't. Is there anything about that that you don't understand?

turns.speaker: OFFICIAL
turns.text: Then I ask you again how you come to be out here with no clothes.

turns.speaker: MOSS
turns.text: Twelfth Infantry Batallion. August seventh nineteen and sixty-six to July second nineteen and sixty-eight.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: She's in a kind of shock. I see all the signs of a post-traumatic reaction with possible dissociative symptoms.

turns.speaker: BALLARD
turns.text: Could I have that in American?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: It's a type of altered state... it allows a traumatized person to continue functioning.
